description: This fields are automatically provided by asset and identity correlation features of applications like Splunk Enterprise Security. Do not define extractions for these fields when writing add-ons.

fields.name: dest_bunit
fields.comment: The business unit of the authentication target.

fields.name: dest_category
fields.comment: The category of the authentication target, such as email_server or SOX-compliant.

fields.name: dest_priority
fields.comment: The priority of the authentication target.

fields.name: dvc_bunit
fields.comment: The business unit of the DLP target.

fields.name: dvc_category
fields.comment: The category of the DLP device.

fields.name: dvc_priority
fields.comment: The priority of the DLP device.

fields.name: src_bunit
fields.comment: The business unit of the authentication source.

fields.name: src_category
fields.comment: The category of the authentication source, such as email_server or SOX-compliant.

fields.name: src_priority
fields.comment: The priority of the authentication source.

fields.name: src_user_bunit
fields.comment: The business unit of the user who initiated the privilege escalation. This field is unnecessary when an escalation has not been performed.

fields.name: src_user_category
fields.comment: The category of the user who initiated the privilege escalation. This field is unnecessary when an escalation has not been performed.

fields.name: src_user_priority
fields.comment: The priority of the user who initiated the privilege escalation. This field is unnecessary when an escalation has not been performed.

fields.name: user_bunit
fields.comment: The business unit of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event. For authentication privilege escalation events, this should represent the user targeted by the escalation.

fields.name: user_category
fields.comment: The category of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event. For authentication privilege escalation events, this should represent the user targeted by the escalation.

fields.name: user_priority
fields.comment: The priority of the user involved in the event, or who initiated the event. For authentication privilege escalation events, this should represent the user targeted by the escalation.

fields.name: tag
fields.comment: This automatically-generated field is used to access tags from within data models. Do not define extractions for this field when writing add-ons.
